introduction.p: This document provides an overview of the key components of a bicycle. It includes descriptions and references to visual aids within a larger technical manual.

visualaidreferences.p: The following figures are referenced throughout this document:

keycomponents.heading: Frame (Refer to Figure 1.1)
keycomponents.p: The bicycle frame is the main structural component, typically constructed from metal tubes welded together. It provides the foundation for all other parts.
keycomponents.heading: Wheels (Refer to Figure 1.2)
keycomponents.p: The wheels enable movement and consist of the following parts:

item.label: Hub
item.description: The central part of the wheel.

item.label: Spokes
item.description: Connect the hub to the rim.

item.label: Metal Rim
item.description: The outer circular part of the wheel.

keycomponents.heading: Seat and Seat Post (Refer to Figure 1.3)
keycomponents.p: The seat and seat post provide a comfortable riding position. The seat post inserts into the seat tube, allowing for height adjustment.
keycomponents.heading: Handlebar and Stem (Refer to Figure 1.4)
keycomponents.p: The handlebar and stem control steering and provide a mounting point for brake levers and shifters.
keycomponents.heading: Cranks (Refer to Figure 1.5)
keycomponents.p: The cranks are levers that extend from the bottom bracket to the pedals, transferring pedaling force to the drivetrain.
keycomponents.heading: Pedals (Refer to Figure 1.6)
keycomponents.p: The pedals are platforms for the feet, attaching to the cranks and receiving pedaling force.
keycomponents.heading: Chain and Gears (Refer to Figure 1.7)
keycomponents.p: The chain and gear system (drivetrain) transmit power from the pedals to the rear wheel. Key components include:

item.label: Front Chain Ring
item.description: The large gear attached to the crank.

item.label: Rear Freewheel (or Cassette)
item.description: The set of gears on the rear wheel.

item.label: Front and Rear Derailleurs
item.description: Mechanisms that move the chain between gears.

item.label: Cables
item.description: Connect the shift lever to the derailleurs.

keycomponents.heading: Brakes (Refer to Figure 1.8)
keycomponents.p: The brake system provides stopping power and includes:

item.label: Brake Cable
item.description: Transmits force from the actuator to the brakes.

item.label: Brake Calipers
item.description: Clamp onto the wheel rim or rotor.

item.label: Brake Pads
item.description: Provide friction to slow or stop the wheel.
